page.title: 12West Haddon Endowed School
page.content: The school has 61 children all of whom come from West Haddon or the outlying farms except for 6 children who come from Winwick. The children are aged between 4 and 11. There are 3 teachers including the Headteacher none of whom live in the village. Everybody else who works at the school lives in the catchment area, including a secretary, a classroom helper, 2 cleaners and 4 ladies who help with dinners. The school has 4 classrooms, a hall, an office and a staff room. It has two playgrounds but one is used as a car park. It has a field half is flat and good for football, half is sloping and bumpy. The school is in two buildings, the old building was built in 1825, the new in 1972.
